other_tests.findings: Sinus bradycardia at a rate of 57 and delayed R-wave progression; otherwise similar to a previous tracing from seven years earlier.

Clear, colorless cerebrospinal fluid contained no red cells and eight white cells per cubic millimeter, predominantly lymphocytes. Glucose level was 64 mg/dL, total protein level was 75 mg/dL, albumin was elevated at 57.1 mg/dL, and IgG level was slightly elevated at 8.1 mg/dL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After the lumbar puncture, the patient showed confusion and neurologic symptoms such as word-finding difficulties and right-side neglect.

other_tests.findings: Chronic perivascular inflammation, loss of normal white matter architecture, numerous macrophages, and moderately well-demarcated areas of myelin loss with relative preservation of axons.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Biopsy findings confirmed a diagnosis of acute demyelinating encephalomyelitis (ADEM); follow-up revealed improved speech fluency and reduction of neurologic deficits.
